bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Franklin County was formed in 1785 from Bedford and Henry Counties.
The letters were used as evidence in a court case. The whereabouts of the other documents from the case is unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Franklin County (Va.) Letters, Mark Anthony to William Ray, 1849-1852. The letters pertain to Anthony's efforts to collect bonds from various people and his arrangements to hire out slaves from several estates, including the estate of William Ralph Smith, John Hall, and Frazer's estate in Campbell County. Anthony discusses the market for hiring out slaves, pregnancies among various slaves, and the condition of a young slave whose arm has been injured and may require amputation.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Franklin County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm."
